enhancedContent.overview: The Muslim Life OS is a comprehensive Islamic life management system designed specifically for practicing Muslims who want to integrate their faith into their daily productivity workflow. This all-in-one Notion template combines spiritual tracking, Quran progress monitoring, prayer time management, and daily planning in one beautifully organized digital space. Unlike generic productivity templates, this specialized system is built around Islamic practices and includes both a feature-rich version and a minimalistic alternative for users who prefer a cleaner interface.

faqs.question: How do I get started with this template?
faqs.answer: After duplicating the template to your Notion workspace, choose between the full-featured or minimalistic version based on your preference. Start by setting up your prayer times, adding your current Quran progress, and customizing the daily routine planner with your schedule. The template includes 10+ pre-built pages that you can explore and personalize.

faqs.question: What's included in this template?
faqs.answer: The template includes prayer time tracking, Quran player and progress recorder, daily habit tracker, customizable countdown timers, Islamic calendar dates, daily routine planner, 10+ organizational pages, and both a full-featured and minimalistic interface version. All core Islamic practices and productivity tools are integrated in one system.

faqs.question: Can I customize this template?
faqs.answer: Yes, the template is fully customizable within Notion. You can modify the pages, add or remove sections, adjust the habit trackers, personalize the countdown timers, and switch between the full or minimalistic versions at any time. The simple layout makes customization accessible even for Notion beginners.

faqs.question: What are the main use cases?
faqs.answer: Primary use cases include tracking the five daily prayers, monitoring Quran reading and memorization progress, building Islamic habits (dhikr, dua, charity), planning daily routines around prayer times, managing personal and spiritual goals, and maintaining an organized Islamic life system. It's ideal for Muslims who want faith-integrated productivity.
